alert.note: Alert for Knox; Peoria; Stark (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 3:00PM CDT until March 31 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN STARK...SOUTHEASTERN KNOX AND NORTHWESTERN PEORIA COUNTIES... At 300 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Toulon, or 12 miles southeast of Kewanee, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Stark, southeastern Knox and northwestern Peoria Counties, including the following locations... Snake Den Hollow, Dahinda, Duncan, Delong and Monica. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 54 and 67. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central, north central and west central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
